title: Boot USB drive from bootable CD?

forumNotes.author: eggbert
forumNotes.content:
I have a bootable USB drive with lots of utilities on, but some computers won't boot from it. Is there something that would boot from a CD that would boot the USB drive? The USB drive uses Syslinux.  
Also is there some kind of utility which would find all bootable devices and partitions on a system and list them?

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
There are no real solutions but workarrounds.  

Computers who can not boot USB have mosttimes still a working legacy floppy. You can use Plop Bootmanager and boot it from floppy or CD and then boot USB (a Plop feature).  

For linux you can also boot USB without native USB boot support, there are helper floppy or CD images for many distros such as debian. For NT like operating systems this isn't that easy.
